other_tests.findings: Granular deposits observed centrally in the interface beneath the flap of both eyes.
other_tests.changes_over_time: BSCVA was still 20/20 in both eyes at the time of observation on October 24, 2002.

other_tests.findings: All patients were heterozygous for the Avellino dystrophy gene.

other_tests.procedure_name: Phototherapeutic keratectomy and treatment with topical mitomycin C
other_tests.findings: Cornea remained relatively clear for 6 months after treatment.
Improvement in best spectacle-corrected visual acuity (BSCVA).
Granular opacities were present along the central flap interface.
other_tests.changes_over_time: BSCVA of the left eye improved to 20/20 three months after the procedure.
